External_Reference.reference_text: Vernov, S. N., Tverskoj, B. A., Borodin, N. F., Gorchakov, E. V., Elizarov, A. E., Ermakov, S. I., Kadobnov, V. B., Kontor, N.N., Lyubimov, G. P., Majdykovskij, I. V., Morozova, T. I., Pereslegina, N. V., Sobachkin, I. V., Stepina, T. I., Tulupov, V. I., Filippychev, S. A., Khotilovskaya, T. G., Measurement of proton and alpha-particle fluxes on VENERA-11 and VENERA-12 space probes, Kosmicheskie Issledovaniya, vol. 17, no. 5, 804-811, 1979.

Ermakov, S. I., Kontor, N. N., Liubimov, G. P., Pereslegina, N. V., Khotilovskaia, T. G., Comparison of Solar Proton Activity in 1967 and 1969 with that in 1978 and 1979 as Measured on board VENERA-4, 6, 11, 12 Space Probes Proc. 17th Int. Cosmic Ray Conf, Paris, France, vol. 3, 81-84, 1981.

Ermakov, S. I., Kontor, N. N, Morosova, T. I., Stepina, T. I., Khachaturyan, G. O., The solar proton fluxes in April, 1979, 17th Int. Cosmic Ray Conf., Conf. papers, Paris, France, vol. 3, 85-87, 1981.

Instrument.name: Venera 11 Energetic Particles, MSU-TASPD
Instrument.description: The Venera 11 Energetic Particles experiment was a Soviet suite of particle detectors that monitored the flux of charged particles of medium energies in interplanetary space during cruise and Venus flyby, specifically measuring protons (>30 and 3-5 MeV) from the sunward direction; and protons (3-5 MeV) from the anti-sunward direction.
